definition: to notate music/to write a score
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: Systems of notation differ widely throughout history and from culture to culture.
sentences.chinese: 整個歷史和各民族的記譜方法千差萬別。

sentences.english: There is notation for the amount of the 13th century Cologne teaching of the founding Blanco Shifu.
sentences.chinese: 有量記譜法爲13世紀科隆教士弗蘭科創始。

sentences.english: All the selected rhyme schemes are notated according to recordings.
sentences.chinese: 所有唱腔選段均依據錄音記譜。

sentences.english: Music notation is a general term to describe the writing down of music.
sentences.chinese: 音樂記譜法是指音符通用書寫方法。

definition: lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
(music) to change key/modulation/(of an employee) to be transferred to another post
colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character
The Travels of Lao Tsan, novel by late Qing novelist Liu E 劉鶚|刘鹗[Liu2 E4]
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
hulusi, aka cucurbit flute (a kind of free reed wind instrument)
